intro: Sisymbrium eremigenum, commonly known as the desert mustard, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Sisymbrium eremigenum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with limited water availability.
